cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 33 (Friday, February 23, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FOSTER:H.R. 7435.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress under Article I, Section 8, Clauses 1 and 18 of theUnited States Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:This bill requires the IRS to establish a program to allowtaxpayers to download forms relating to individual income taxreturns that are pre-populated with return informationreported to the IRS.[Page H692]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

cdata.text:
Autofill Act of 2024

This bill requires the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to establish a program to allow taxpayers to download forms relating to individual income tax returns that are populated with return information reported to the IRS. The IRS must make such return information available not later than 15 days after it receives the information and must make such information available in both a printable document file and in a computer-readable form suitable for use by automated tax preparation software.

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a program to populate downloadable tax forms with taxpayer return information.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
